name: Massimo Vega
comment info:
One of the things I noticed was the variety of career paths that the 2024 candidates followed before reaching the political stage. Donald Trump stands out for his extensive time in business before turning to politics which was more private, while JD Vance also has significant time in private service compared to Kamala Harris and Tim Walz. Harris has dedicated much of her career to the public, including roles like District Attorney, Attorney General, and eventually Vice President. Meanwhile, Tim Walz's career shows a mix of military service and education before entering government.

How do different career paths influence political perspectives? Is more time spent in the private sector versus the public sector impact a candidate's policy priorities? The data provided is quite large so little summary: Trump get Bachelor's degree in economics and was businessmen before he gets to be president; Vance military service men then lawyer then member of senate then candidate to vice president; Kamala solid path in the government positions; Walz army servicemen, teacher, from 2007 US representative and then remains in politics. The Vice president is not a whole team, thus the data chart lacks this information. Despite the president being the most powerful human in the counturi, still presidential power is limited by the senate, congress etc.

Headline: 2024 Candidates: Different Job Experiences, Different Focus for the Country

What I notice:
I see that all the candidates went to college, but they studied different things. Kamala Harris and JD Vance both studied law, while Tim Walz focused on education. JD Vance and Tim Walz both served in the military—Vance in the Marines and Walz in the Army National Guard. Donald Trump has worked in business for a long time. Kamala Harris has spent many years in public service, starting as a district attorney and later becoming a senator and vice president. Tim Walz began his career as a teacher before becoming a politician, serving as a congressman and governor.

What I wonder:
How will their different job experiences affect their decisions if they win? Will Vance or Walz want to give more money to the military? Will their backgrounds in careers or education change how voters feel about them? I also wonder why Trump decided to run for president after being in business for so long.

What I think is going on:
The graph suggests that each candidate’s past experiences will likely influence what they believe is most important for the country if they are elected.

How this relates to me and my community:
This matters to my community because these potential vice presidents and presidents could be chosen in our country. This graph helps us understand what to expect from our political leaders.

name: Lily AOSE
comment info:
Headline: "Career Paths Unveiled: The Journeys of Four Political Figures"
Analyzing the career timelines of Donald Trump, Kamala Harris, Tim Walz, and JD Vance reveals both similarities and differences. All four candidates attended prestigious colleges, with Harris at Howard University and Trump at Wharton, establishing a strong educational foundation. However, their career trajectories diverged significantly: Trump built his brand in real estate and entertainment, while Harris rose through the legal and political ranks, serving as Attorney General of California. Walz, with a background in education and military service, transitioned from a schoolteacher to a U.S. Congressman, whereas Vance's journey is rooted in venture capitalism and his memoir on social issues. I wonder how these varied experiences shaped their leadership styles and policy priorities. This resonates with me because, as an American citizen, I want leaders who possess the knowledge and experience necessary to govern effectively and prioritize the well-being of the American people. Understanding the backgrounds of our leaders is crucial, as it helps us assess their qualifications and commitment to serving our country.

comment info:
I notice many interesting things in this graph, mostly each candidates background. Trump, the oldest candidate, has been a businessman all of his life, creating more money wherever he can, taking multiple TV stints for the same goal. JD Vance, the youngest candidate, has spent most of his life in law, and then politics, after he graduated. He lacks the most experience, although his experience certainly does not discredit him by any means. Kamala Harris has spent all of her life in law as well, climbing up the ranks into politics after almost 20 years in the field. Finally, Tim Walz. name: Ricardo Castillo
comment info:
1) What do you notice?

After analyzing the graph, the graph reveals a clear difference in experience between the Democratic and Republican nominees. The Democratic candidates, Kamala Harris and Tim Walz, have much more background in public service and government roles. Harris has served in several positions in the California legal system and Congress, while Walz has spent time in education and the National Guard. In contrast, the Republican nominees, Donald Trump and JD Vance, have more experience in the private sector. Trump had no prior political experience until his 2016 nomination, and Vance, though he served in the Marines, didn’t get involved in government until he became a senator in 2021.

2) What do you wonder?

I wonder how their different career paths might shape their policies and approach to governing. Does having more civic experience make someone better suited for leadership, or does experience in the private sector offer a better perspective?

3) How does this relate to you and your community?

This graph relates to my community and I because it makes me think about the different paths people take to become leaders. Seeing how much experience the Democratic nominees had in government before running for higher office is pretty eye-opening. As a 17 year old it open my eyes to details I should look into before voting next year.

4) What’s going on in this graph?

Experience Gap: Comparing Civic and Private Sector Backgrounds of Democratic and Republican Nominees

name: Charles Davis
comment info: This graph shows a stark contrast in experience between the Republican ticket and the Democrat ticket. The Democrat nominees have much more experience with civic duties. For example, Kamala Harris served in many different roles in the California Legal system - even becoming attorney general - and congress. Tim Walz dedicated much of his life to educating the future generations and served his country as a part of the U.S. Army National Guard. Compare this with the Republican nominees, who have much more experience in private enterprise and were much less involved in the civic duties, with Donald Trump only working as a businessman until he became the Republican Nominee in 2016. JD Vance served in the Marine Corps during operation Iraqi freedom, however was not as involved in governmental affairs following his service and until he became a senator in 2021. Overall, the graph shows who has more experience when it comes to helping American and understanding the American system of governance‹. Presidential nominee Kamala Harris and Vice Presidential nominee Tim Walz have much more experience with serving regular people and have a much more in depth track record when it comes to serving our country.
